replies.text: Good company. I owned it a few years ago but sold out for a profit. Its an American company on paper but the majority of their revenues comes from china, which is why youre seeing the breakout.
Held for a year or so, been quite bloody despite consistently positive news. Nice to finally have some momentum

i dont understand how the net profit margin seems to be decreasing, but overall revenue continues to go up, and from what i read, they are one of the top dogs in the market. also, imho, its never a bad idea to bet against china in an emerging tech sector. i think its severely undervalued. although, if you had asked me yesterday, apparently, they have issues with too much product not sold? but then today they released some report about backorders??? imo i think its a good play.
will the recent china stimulus impact this company? if so, how?

i dont understand how the net profit margin seems to be decreasing, but overall revenue continues to go I work in manufacturing, so I can answer this one... if you put in more OT and pay expedites at OV suppliers in order to get product out the door, your revenue can go up at smaller margins.

content.text: How are we feeling about ACMR?

replies.text: I also was interested. Seems the downside is if the US adds more export controls on semis. Since majority of their revenue is China. Even if they just have cleaning equipment. Decided against it. Plenty of other stocks out there.
I did a lot of research into them months ago. Good stock
Chinese companies are often scams. My favorite recent one by Hindenberg was Golden Heaven Group. Hilarious

Type in the wrong symbol and it will be fine, lol. AMCR ACMR is eating turds real good. Who cares why its going down if you dont own it. Maybe you will be able to pick it up for 3 some day. Or glad that you didnt. Theyve had some quarters with negative cash flow and they have been doing some financing.

I understand it to be a risk, but it really seems to have moved absurdly considering. First of all IF but was there significant news regarding tariffs, this week for example that Im missing that would tank it? I know a couple months ago Trump mentioned it and the market got spooked for a few days, but that should be priced in by now if not already forgotten, as the rest of the market seemed to do. And even if America increases tariffs enough that semi manufacturing majorly comes to the US, acmr seems to be in a pretty great position to grow with it? Seems the more in depth I look at the performance, the less it makes sense
They manufacture in China and sell to China, so export controls wouldnt be a big factor
Even if they are headquartered in the US, California?
I could be wrong but I think so Also technically the US ACMR is an umbrella corporation that owns 85 of the Shanghai company that does the actual manufacturing

Guys, this poster is a scammer. He wants you to believe that this public company is a complete fake and a fraud, and the stock will slump; however, he claims that  if you listen to his "expertise" (the scam) and buy options on the share price you will become a millionaire (the bait).

He posts here every day from India using different names (Walker, Bull, Coach, Brad.H, Concerned Citizen....he does the same in other stock conversations). Sometimes he is even using Daniel (like my name) to create confusion since I uncovered his hoax. Don't be fooled by his stupidity, I will always be Daniel10571; in case of doubt always check my profile to verify who is the real one. This scammer seeks to trap naive folks by fantasizing about his options trading method (puts and calls) and claiming that he is making a fortune here and could also make you very rich; once you fall for his lies he will contact you directly and ask you for money "to teach you options trading" and "to invest with him". Of course, once you send him the funds (using a Google Play card or similar pre-paid) that will be the last you see of that cash. 

Don't fall for this hoax, ignore his false advertisement and silence him, like many have done here already.  Be cautious and reach instead to a licensed broker or your financial institution for professional advice on  derivatives if these instruments interest you. Unfortunately the site moderator has not managed to block all these phonies yet.
